code: library(chromer) sol_gen <- chrom_counts(taxa = "Solanum", rank = "genus") head(sol_gen) nrow(sol_gen) sol_tom <- chrom_counts(taxa = "Solanum_lycopersicum", rank = "species") head(sol_tom) sol_fam <- chrom_counts(taxa = "Solanaceae", rank = "family") head(sol_fam) ang <- chrom_counts(taxa = "Angiosperms", rank = "majorGroup") head(ang) sol_gen_full <- chrom_counts("Solanum", rank = "genus", full = TRUE) head(sol_gen_full)

Second, many counts combined text characters (e.g., "#-#", "c.#", "#, #, #". function uses regular expressions pull numeric values strings. Third, records gametophytic (n) counts others sporophytes (2n); function simply divides sporophytic counts half measurements common scale. IMPORTANT: Use function caution. Parsing counts programmatically may useful may generate erroneous results cases input odd format. example, count "#+-#", function return first second # valid counts .
